did.abstract: Papers of John Fauchereaud Grimké, U.S. Continental soldier and South Carolina jurist; of his son, Thomas Smith Grimké; and of his grandson, Edward Montague Grimké. Included are references to supplies for the Continental Army, ratification of the peace treaty between the United States and Great Britain, the activities of the North Carolina Assembly, the affairs of the Broad River Company, epistemology, and financial and personal matters. Also included are letters concerning the estates of John F. Grimké's father and of Thomas Roper, husband of Mary Smith Grimké Roper.
